prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system: * Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: 1. [0.0, 0.0] 2. [0.5, 0.0] 3. [0.5, 0.5] 4. [0.0, 0.5] 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.5. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by rotating it around the Z-axis by -90.0 degrees and translating it along the Y-axis by 0.75 units. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.5 units to create the 3D model. Part 2: Construct a smaller rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, placed on top of the first prism. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.25, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system: * Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: 1. [0.0, 0.0] 2. [0.1711, 0.0] 3. [0.1711, 0.2049] 4. [0.0, 0.2049] 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.2049. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by rotating it around the Z-axis by -90.0 degrees and translating it along the Y-axis by 0.25 units. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.2049 units to create the 3D model. 6. Join the new prism with the previously created prism. The final CAD model is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and dimensions of 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. The first prism has a width, length, and height of 0.25 units each, and the second prism has a width of 0.25 units, a length of 0.2049 units, and a height of 0.2049 units.</description>
